profile_data.summary:
As a Product Engineer II at Southern Linc, I leverage my 12 years of experience in radio frequency (RF) engineering to support the operation of a regional LTE network that supplies cellular services to the 3rd largest utility company in the United States. I am passionate about wireless technology and certification, and I have been involved in various projects related to 5G, 6G, and IoT.

In addition to my role at Southern Linc, I also volunteer as an RF Engineer for ASMAT.ORG, a non-profit organization that promotes wireless communication and collaborates with NASA and Space-X. I provide test plans guidance, testing, and direction for the organization. Previously, I was an Engineering Team Lead at Wipro Infrastructure Engineering, where I led the Conformance Team in planning 5G certification testing for 3GPP, GCF, and PTCRB. I hold certifications in 5G Technology Strategy, Test Automation with Python, and IoT Foundations: Low-Power Wireless Networking.
profile_data.headline: Certification Manager

experience.description:
• Provided feedback on Maintenance Releases from Samsung to determine regression testing needs for existing devices on the network.
• Collaborated with OEM to develop software packages aligning with the network for new devices.
• Supported utility PTT devices, field workers, RAN team, and professional staff with communications.
experience.title: Product Engineer II

experience.description: I work as a Volunteer RF Engineer for ASMAT.ORG. A great organization, working relationship with NASA and Space-X.  My role is to provide test plans guidance, testing and direction. Amsat.org is directly connected to the ARRL, HAMFEST, FCC ITU, WIFI Alliance and promoting wireless communication everywhere. If you are an RF Engineer and love your profession, I absolutely suggest getting involved with Asmat.org today.
experience.title: Radio Frequency Engineer

experience.description:
Little about the lab:
AUSTIN, Texas & BENGALURU, India--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO), a leading technology services and consulting company, announced the opening of its new 5G Def-i Innovation Center (“the Center”) in Austin, Texas, underscoring the company’s commitment to helping clients realize the benefits of 5G technology through safer, more sustainable, and compliant products and services.

My Role:

•	Led the Conformance Team in planning of 5G certification testing for 3GPP, GCF and PTCRB.  Utilized Keysight’s S8704A test platform for Signaling conformance testing test plans such as TS. 38.523-1 “Signaling Conformance” and TS.34.229-5 “IMS IP Session management” for 5G FR1 & FR2. 
•	Also utilized Keysight’s S8705A test platform for RF, RRM & Performance Test plans for FR1 such as: TS.38.521-1 “5G Stand-Alone”, TS. 38.521-3 “LTE & NR Dual Connectivity”, “TS. 38.533-1 “Radio resource Management (Stand-Alone and Dual Connectivity)”, TS.38.521-4, Performance Enhanced for RF & RRM. 
•	Appointed Vice-Chair for the PTCRB sub-working group “Cellular Conformance Test Case Reduction.”
•	Developed and executed comprehensive test plans for Audits and future demonstrations, ensuring compliance with 3GPP, GCF, and PTCRB standards.
•	Conducted O-RAN/ VRAN testing and set-up for the remote O-RAN Team. utilizing Keysight’s O-RAN P705xA Test System, Wave Judge Analyzer for real-time decoding and PHY analysis, and Open RAN Studio Software for Split Option 7.2x (O-RU categories A & B) Testing and Validation suite: U5040BSCB.
•	Managed and oversaw a 5G Private Cellular Network (Band 48 Only) (Sponsored by Selona” & “Cradlepoint” for improved performance and customer peace of mind.
•	Managed AWS Cloud Network infrastructure, including VPCs, subnets, Direct Connect, S3 buckets, and security groups.
•	Collaborated with cross-functional teams to integrate new technologies and remote access to all required teams.
experience.title: Engineering Team Lead

experience.description:
As a world leader in testing, inspection and certification services, and a pioneer in global certification contracts, Bureau Veritas is renowned for its vast geographical reach, market expertise and rigorous approach. With more than 7,500 auditors delivering over 100 certification products and auditing solutions, it is no wonder that more than 60% of all Fortune 500 companies use Bureau Veritas Certification.

My Role:
I was hired as a Senior RF Test Engineer to assist the compliance Department with device testing. We are accredited by ISO 17025 to perform FCC and ETSI certifications for wireless Devices. While I was there, I executed test plans from the FCC for Intentional and non-intentional radiators for Part 15 B and C. ETSI EN 300-330, EN 301 893 for Radar. We were known for our expert knowledge in device set-ups of Receive-Blocking and DFS Wi-Fi simulations. I loved everyone here, it was one of the best jobs I ever had. Life led me to Austin, Texas later in the year otherwise,  I would still be there.
experience.title: Sr. RF Engineer

experience.description: In 2011  I was specifically hired to assist testing with 4G ( LTE devices) The Wireless department focused on residential-consumer side products for the most part. We mainly saw hand-held smart phones, Tablets, Laptops and router/data devices.  We started as a runoff lab for Verizon during the introduction of LTE (4G). As LTE became ever more popular our business started to rapidly grow. In just a few years we started performing certifications for US Cellular, Sprint and T-Mobile. As time went on we grew to global certifications for PTRCB and GCF. I started in the Protocol/Signaling area. We tested global Protocols, Data Throughput and some Carrier specific test plans for protocols and Data Throughput, GPS and Location Based Services. As we hired more capable Engineers I was moved over to test RF ( Antenna and power related testing) . After a few years we went from one LTE RF & RRM rack to five RF racks, a stand-alone RRM rack and a stand-alone GPS/LBS rack. The majority of the test equipment we used was from Rohde & Schwartz. I had created training programs for new hires, assisted with scheduling calibrations, provided test instructions for our other labs in California, Taiwan and China. Once 5G entered the scene we added 5G GPS, Data Throughput, RF and RRM testing scenarios. Most of our equipment used a form of Linux as the OS. We used simple AutoIT and Python scripts to automate user devices. On our customer portal we created a visually automated graph to illustrate what CA combinations were tested and which test cases passed or failed. We used a lot of Visual Basic and C++ to help with this. We had an army of test platforms, R&S TS-8980 variations 8980-FTA, 8980FTA2A, 8980 FTA3, Anritsu PCT and RF test system and a FR1 & FR2 5G Keysight mmWave test system.
experience.title: Sr. Associate Engineer/ Conformance Carrier Certification Testing

volunteer.description:
This is a wonderful group. I discovered this organization while studying for a wireless certification. This group promotes education for all age-groups, skill-levels and promoters. They main purpose is to build, test and provide even more Ham radio coverage world-wide. They have real satellites orbiting the earth today and have future launches scheduled. This is a great opportunity to have real-life hands on testing and verifying real working satellites. I am so excited not only to be a member but also to be activly involved in a group such as this one. The next Annual AMSAT Space Symposium & Annual General Meeting is in Tampa Bay Florida in late October. I hope to be there in person. Below is more information about the group:

The Radio Amateur Satellite Corporation (as AMSAT is officially known) is a scientific and educational non-profit corporation chartered in the District of Columbia in 1969. We design, construct, test, and operate space stations in the amateur satellite service. We also make available a variety of publications, computer programs, educational services, and internet services, promoting space science education among radio amateurs and students worldwide.

For over 50 years AMSAT has played a key role in significantly advancing the state of the art in space science, space education, and space technology. Undoubtedly, the work now being done by AMSAT volunteers throughout the world will continue to have far-reaching, positive effects on the future of Amateur Radio, as well as other governmental, scientific and commercial activities in the space, the final frontier.

Volunteered as the Vice-Chair for the Test case reduction sub-working group of PTCRB. The Goal of this sub-working group was to identify and reduce any over lapping testing that was currently being required for certification of mobile handsets for LTE and/ or NR Band and Bandwidth combinations.

Volunteer for the Over-the-Air Performance Testing Sub-Working Group of CTIA ( PTCRB). CTIA Certification is proud to have developed the industry standard for OTA performance testing of wireless devices. Our test plans thoroughly measure the expected real-world performance of a device in a simulated laboratory environment. They accurately determine the transmit and receive efficiency of a device’s antenna(s). Network operators throughout the world rely on CTIA Certification’s OTA performance testing to ensure devices operating on their networks will meet the performance expectations demanded by consumers and businesses.

projects.description: Cellular Certification Lab Establishment: Played a key role in setting up a new certification lab, obtaining ISO/IEC 17025:2017, GCF and PTCRB accreditation.
